title: How to Make Chocolate Granola

steps.headline: Set the oven to 170°C (338°F or Gas Mark 3).
steps.description: Don't put the oven temperature on too high as it is important granola doesn't burn.

steps.headline: Add the oats, desiccated coconut, nuts, cocoa powder and sugar in a bowl and mix together.
Heat the avocado oil and syrup on low heat in a small pan.
steps.description: Warm them until they have combined.

steps.headline: Pour the heated oil and syrup over the oat mixture and mix well.
steps.description: The pieces should mostly be sticking together in small lumps but not too much.

steps.headline: Spread the granola evenly onto a baking tray and bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Turn the granola over halfway so it is evenly baked.

steps.headline: Take the granola out of the oven and leave to cool entirely.
Add the chocolate chips to the cooled granola.
steps.description: If you add the chocolate when the granola is still hot, it will melt.

text: Set the oven to 170°C (338°F or Gas Mark 3). Don't put the oven temperature on too high as it is important granola doesn't burn. Add the oats, desiccated coconut, nuts, cocoa powder and sugar in a bowl and mix together.  Heat the avocado oil and syrup on low heat in a small pan. Warm them until they have combined. Pour the heated oil and syrup over the oat mixture and mix well. The pieces should mostly be sticking together in small lumps but not too much. Spread the granola evenly onto a baking tray and bake in the oven for 20 minutes. Turn the granola over halfway so it is evenly baked. Take the granola out of the oven and leave to cool entirely.  Add the chocolate chips to the cooled granola. If you add the chocolate when the granola is still hot, it will melt. Enjoy!
